title: Does Formula 1 need more sprint races? 'Absolutely not!' - fans have their say
summary: Formula 1's sprint races have added some drama to the calendar, but with rumours of the format expanding to as many as 10 or 12 weekends, the series faces a key question: is more always better?

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of sprint races in Formula 1?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: To add drama and excitement to the race weekend.
wrong_options: To increase the total points available in the championship.
To provide teams with additional testing opportunities.

qa_pairs.question: How many sprint races were initially introduced in Formula 1?
What is a common concern among fans regarding the potential increase in sprint races?
qa_pairs.correct_answer: That more races may dilute the excitement and significance of the main race weekend.
wrong_options: That it will lead to fewer teams participating.
That it will make the races shorter than traditional distances.
That it will increase the cost of participating in the sport.
